text: [Music]
hi I'm da ha a cloud support engineer
here at AWS in Dublin sometimes
customers ask me how they can backup
their Amazon light-sealed configuration
and data I tell them they can do this
using snapshots a snapshot is a copy of
the current state of your configuration
at a certain point in time you can use
snapshots to launch an instance and you
can also use snapshots to recover the
data saved at the time the snapshot was
taken it is a best practice to take a
snapshot before making major changes in
your system snapshots are also useful
for resizing your instance if you want
to switch to a larger plan let me walk
you through the process of snapshots
creation and recovery to get consistent
snapshots it is a best practice to stop
the instance first after logging into
the AWS management console navigate to
the lightsail console
on the instances tab choose the light
sail instance you want to back up switch
to snapshot stop the web interface
offers a default name for your snapshot
in the format similar to Amazon Linux
memory region - 1 - system name the
snapshot something that you will
recognize later the name cannot contain
spaces choose create snapshot
wait for the snapshot to complete it can
take a little while depending on the
data that is backed up
refresh the page from the snapshots tab
under recent snapshots you can see the
new snapshot you created
to launch an instance from the snapshot
choose the three orange dots to the
right of the snapshots name and then
select create new instance
optionally you can customize the new
instance by adding launched script
changing SSH key pair or choosing a
different instance size you can simply
accept the default option and hit create
you can also move your static IP address
from the old instance to the new one and
then start using that instance as your
primary instance
thanks for watching and happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
you
